div.p: In Business - I think if Health will permit it is a very good thing to be in the workshops at 2pm to see all at their work doing it correctly and properly.

Saturdays I think the time for the one who takes duty might be 8 to 3 short cold lunch making 57 hours which is more than the workman make to make up for the the following week he has but 50 hours to make and which with probable over minutes will bring the working Masters hours to an average of 54 Hours weekly as at present worked in shops June17th 1890
